title: Matchmaking is still not fixed....
body:
The games have slightly closer ranks, but im still getting matched against either high plats or low diamonds

As a silver, it is impossible (short of luck) to beat a rank that is that much higher than me... Please fix

replies.body:
In your past 20 games, you have been matched with against a plat 5 player on two separate occasions. When looking a bit deeper, it appears that they have silver flex rank, and are queuing with lower solo rank players that have the bronze-silver flex rank. Hence, they are ending up in your games. In flex games you have to look at **flex ranks** and not solo ranks. 

Flex and solo MMR are separate, with the quick flex reset (even though it was pretty messed up) the only interaction they will likely have with each other. 
Also, because it's a pretty new queue it will take a while for players to get back to their usual ranks (especially for a  ~month after a MMR reset).

If you want to have balanced games, wait a month before playing ranked queues. The MMR will reset again for both queues on the 7th of December, and I would suggest not playing till mid January when everything would have settled down again.

Flex = not solo/duo mmr.

Before the fix, the diamond/plat could have been playing with low elo and that's why the mmr of their Flex is low and therefore they are still playing with you now. Eventually, I think the whole thing would fix itself and everything would turn back into normal.

Tbh, flex queue is really just a time killer to wait for the real deal to start which is next season.
I had a game today with 1 plat 5, 1 gold 5 and 3 silvers vs all bronze that was fun

Yeh. I was in my promos to Gold on Flex que, had 6 diamond players in the game (2 on my team, 3 on the other). Granted they were only Plat on Flex Que, but still, it was my Gold promos and I was the lowest ranked player by almost an entire tier and i qued alone.

The whole game was diamond and plat players except for me (gold 2 in solo/duo, silver 1 in flex).

But the way i saw it. I learnt what i need to improve on from that game. The diamond players had a much better understanding of the macro level of the game even though their laning was roughly about the same, so it was although frustrating, a worthy outing.
